content.question: An Atwood's machine consists of two blocks connected by a light string that passes over a set of ideal pulleys, as shown above. Blocks <math alttext="A," overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have masses <math alttext="one half M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> , respectively. The blocks are released from rest and block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> moves downward with an acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="lowercase a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Next, a block of mass <math alttext="one fourth M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is attached to block <math alttext="A," overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> , and the system is again released from rest. Which of the following gives the change in acceleration of block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
